item.title: 大石油公司交易台向投资者发出警告信息
item.description:
壳牌公司首席执行官在第二季度利润下降后表示，地缘政治导致的市场波动不利于企业发展。【原文：

Geopolitics-led volatility in the market isn’t good for business, Shell CEO says after drop in second-quarter profit.

】

item.title: 人工智能初创公司 Anaconda 新一轮估值达 15 亿美元
item.description: 据一位熟悉内情的人士透露，人工智能初创公司Anaconda Inc.已完成新一轮融资，估值达15亿美元。【原文：Artificial intelligence startup Anaconda Inc. has raised a new funding round that values the company at $1.5 billion, according to a person familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 小麦维持在五月份低点附近，受美元走强和美国出口的影响
item.description: 小麦期货接近5月份以来的最低水平，因为交易商权衡了美元近期的走强和即将公布的美国出口数据。【原文：Wheat futures traded near the lowest level since May as traders weighed the dollar’s recent strength against upcoming US export figures.】

item.title: 挑战者数据显示，人工智能和关税导致美国裁员计划激增
item.description: 根据职业介绍公司 Challenger, Gray & Christmas 的数据，7 月份裁员计划激增，远高于大流行病以来的平均水平，其中科技公司是裁员最多的行业。【原文：Plans to reduce staff spiked in July to a level that was well above the average for the month since the pandemic, with technology firms leading sectors trimming their workforce, according to data from outplacement firm Challenger, Gray & Christmas.】

item.title: 加拿大鹅因消费者销售额增加而超出预期收入
item.description: 奢侈品大衣制造商加拿大鹅控股公司（Canada Goose Holdings Inc.【原文：Luxury-coat maker Canada Goose Holdings Inc. beat revenue estimates on higher direct-to-consumer sales.】

item.title: Lyft 完成 Freenow 收购，不打算裁员
item.description: Lyft 公司已获得必要的监管许可，完成了对欧洲打车应用 Freenow 的收购，为这家美国共享出行公司将业务扩展到欧洲创造了条件。【原文：Lyft Inc. has gained the necessary regulatory clearance to complete its acquisition of European taxi app Freenow, setting the stage for the US rideshare company to expand its operations into Europe.】

item.title: 康卡斯特失去的宽带互联网客户少于预期
item.description: 康卡斯特公司（Comcast Corp. ）公布的销售额和利润均好于预期，尽管该公司的互联网和有线电视客户仍在不断流失。【原文：Comcast Corp. reported better than expected sales and profit, even as it continued to lose internet and cable-TV customers.】

item.title: 乐天推出人工智能购物和投资助手
item.description: 欢迎收看 Tech In Depth，这是彭博社全球记者关于科技商业的每日时事通讯。今天，Min Jeong Lee 将解释日本电子商务巨头乐天为何要推出人工智能助手。【原文：Welcome to Tech In Depth, our daily newsletter about the business of tech from Bloomberg’s journalists around the world. Today, Min Jeong Lee explains why the Japanese e-commerce giant Rakuten is launching an AI assistant.】

item.title: 鲍威尔的鹰派倾向加剧了与白宫的紧张关系
item.description: 我是克里斯-安斯蒂，波士顿的经济编辑。今天我们关注美联储主席鲍威尔的鹰派倾向。请将反馈和建议发送至 ecodaily@bloomberg.net。如果您还没有注册，请点击这里。【原文：I’m Chris Anstey, an economics editor in Boston. Today we’re looking at Fed Chair Powell’s hawkish tilt. Send us feedback and tips to ecodaily@bloomberg.net. And if you aren’t yet signed up to receive this newsletter, you can do so here.】

item.title: 特朗普关税限期前夜到来，惊喜连连
item.description: 欢迎来到丛林— 唐纳德-特朗普总统新的基准关税税率重塑了全球贸易体系，他表示不会推迟这一税率。【原文：Welcome to the jungle — the global trading system reshaped by President Donald Trump’s new baseline tariff rates that he signaled won’t be postponed.】

item.title: 三星新款 Galaxy Z Fold 7 销量超过上一代机型 50
item.description: 三星电子公司周四表示，其最新款高端可折叠手机在美国的销量比上一代机型高出50%，这表明该类别手机至少在消费者中形成了一定的势头。【原文：Samsung Electronics Co. on Thursday said that US sales of its latest, high-end foldable phone are outpacing the prior model by 50%, a sign that the category is establishing at least some momentum with consumers.】

item.title: KKR 费用抵消了退出放缓的影响，业绩超出分析师预期
item.description: KKR & Co.公布的财报显示，尽管传统投资项目的退出速度有所放缓，但管理费的增加推动了公司盈利的增长，从而进一步推动了公司在关键增长领域的发展。【原文：KKR & Co. is pushing further into key growth areas as it reports earnings that were boosted by an uptick in management fees, even as exits from traditional investments have slowed.】

item.title: 法拉利盈利增长，豪华车制造商摆脱关税影响
item.description: 由于对 SF90 XX 和 12Cilindri 车型以及定制超级跑车的强劲需求帮助抵消了额外的关税支出，法拉利公司第二季度盈利攀升。【原文：Ferrari NV’s earnings climbed in the second quarter as robust demand for its SF90 XX and 12Cilindri models and customized supercars helped offset additional tariff expenses.】

item.title: 经济保持良好，美元迎来特朗普任期内最好的一个月
item.description: 随着世界最大经济体的强劲发展和唐纳德-特朗普总统签署贸易协议，美元迎来了 2025 年最好的一个月。【原文：The dollar is wrapping up its best month of 2025 as the world’s largest economy powers ahead and President Donald Trump inks trade deals.】

item.title: 鲍威尔的讲话提高了就业报告的风险
item.description:
债券交易员减少了对美联储宽松政策的押注，但股票投资者似乎并不介意。【原文：

Bond traders pare their bets on Fed easing, though equity investors don’t seem to mind, for now.

】

item.title: 英国反垄断局称亚马逊和微软必须面对更严厉的英国反垄断调查
item.description: 英国监察机构在经过长达 21 个月的调查后表示，根据英国新的数字市场规则，微软公司和亚马逊公司（Amazon Inc.【原文：Microsoft Corp. and an Amazon Inc. unit’s dominance in the cloud services market must face an antitrust investigation under the UK’s new rules for digital markets, the country’s watchdog said after 21 month-long investigation.】

item.title: 人工智能困境引投资者关注，苹果反弹看似遥遥无期
item.description: 苹果公司的财报不太可能给投资者带来他们一直在寻找的催化剂，以重振这家 iPhone 制造商苦苦挣扎的股价。【原文：Apple Inc.’s earnings report is unlikely to give investors the catalyst they’ve been looking for to revive the iPhone maker’s struggling stock price.】

item.title: 中东财富基金希望通过私募市场支点出售全部资产
item.description: 一般来说，财富基金并不以突然改变战略、颠覆投资模式而闻名。一家鲜为人知的中东投资者却偏离了这一论调，计划出售其全部 12 亿美元的遗留资产，作为转向私人市场的一部分。【原文：Wealth funds aren’t generally known for making sudden strategic changes that upend their investment models. A little-known Middle Eastern investor is deviating from that thesis, with plans to sell all $1.2 billion of its legacy assets as part of a pivot toward private markets.】

item.title: 被制裁的亿万富翁关联公司输掉 2.12 亿欧元英国债券诉讼案
item.description: Maire SpA 公司及其两家贷款人赢得了英国法院的一项裁决，驳回了一家与受制裁的亿万富翁有关联的公司提出的 2.12 亿欧元（2.43 亿美元）的索偿要求。【原文：Maire SpA and its two lenders won a UK court ruling against a €212 million ($243 million) demand by a company linked to a sanctioned billionaire.】

item.title: 痴迷播客的科技投资者如何造就了新媒体产业
item.description:
由风险投资家主持的播客引领了科技领域的潮流，改变了业内人士和其他所有人了解初创企业世界的方式。【原文：

Podcasts hosted by venture capitalists set the narrative in tech, changing the way that insiders—and everyone else—learn about the world of startups.

】

item.title: 特朗普征收关税在 8 月 1 日截止日期前面临法律考验
item.description: 美国上诉法院周四将对唐纳德-特朗普总统征收的大部分全球关税的合法性进行权衡，届时这些关税将面临最大的考验。【原文：The bulk of President Donald Trump’s global tariffs face their biggest test yet when a US appeals court weighs arguments on their legality Thursday, a day before higher rates against many countries are set to kick in.】

item.title: 南非被敦促在关税截止日期前为美国贸易协议增添甜头
item.description: 在比勒陀利亚等待美国总统唐纳德-特朗普将对其出口到世界最大经济体的产品征收何种关税之际，美国敦促南非改善其贸易提议。【原文：The US urged South Africa to improve its trade offer as Pretoria waits to hear what tariff President Donald Trump will impose on its exports to the world’s largest economy.】

item.title: SK Hynix 首次超越三星成为顶级内存制造商
item.description: SK 海力士公司在第二季度超越三星电子公司，成为全球第一大内存制造商，这主要归功于人工智能驱动的需求。【原文：SK Hynix Inc. surpassed Samsung Electronics Co. as the world’s top memory maker in the second quarter, largely due to AI-driven demand.】

item.title: 美国债券交易员关注通胀，为 9 月降息寻找方向
item.description: 美国债券交易员将仔细研究周四公布的通胀数据，寻找价格压力持续存在的迹象，这可能会促使美联储在更长时间内提高借贷成本。【原文：US bond traders will scour inflation data due Thursday for signs of persistent price pressures that could encourage the Federal Reserve to keep borrowing costs higher for longer.】

item.title: 食品价格飙升，肯尼亚通胀率升至三个月新高
item.description: 由于全国主食蔬菜和玉米供应紧张，肯尼亚 7 月份的年通货膨胀率攀升至三个月来的最高点。【原文：Kenya’s annual inflation rate climbed to a three-month high in July on tight supplies of vegetables and corn, the nation’s staple.】

item.title: 孟加拉国在关税不确定的情况下维持关键利率不变
item.description: 孟加拉国央行连续第四次会议维持基准利率不变，决策者在关税不确定的情况下保持警惕。【原文：Bangladesh’s central bank kept its benchmark interest rates unchanged for the fourth straight meeting, as policymakers remain on guard amid tariff uncertainty.】

item.title: 象牙海岸正与 StanChart 和法国兴业银行商谈 8 亿欧元贷款事宜
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，象牙海岸计划从渣打银行（Standard Chartered Plc）和法国兴业银行（Société Générale SA）安排的银团贷款中筹集 8 亿欧元（约合 9.16 亿美元），以帮助为预算提供资金。【原文：Ivory Coast plans to raise €800 million ($916 million) in syndicated loans arranged by Standard Chartered Plc and Société Générale SA to help fund its budget, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 华尔街建议为八月股市平静期的结束进行对冲
item.description: 美国银行（Bank of America Corp. ）的策略师们提出了一种防范八月突然出现动荡的方法，最近几周股市异常平静，而八月历来是股市动荡的时期。【原文：Bank of America Corp. strategists are suggesting a way to protect against any sudden bouts of turbulence in August, a historically choppy time for a stock market that’s been unusually calm in recent weeks.】

item.title: 间谍头目称澳大利亚 24 财年间谍活动耗资 80 亿澳元
item.description: 澳大利亚间谍头目表示，间谍活动将在 2024 财年给澳大利亚经济造成至少 125 亿澳元（80 亿美元）的损失。【原文：Australia’s spy chief said espionage cost the economy a minimum A$12.5 billion ($8 billion) in fiscal 2024, as he seeks to raise awareness about the intensification of foreign efforts to steal information.】

item.title: 壳牌首席执行官承诺应对陷入低迷的化工业务
item.description: 壳牌石油公司首席执行官承诺将扭转公司化工业务的困境，他说，该业务正遭受长期以来最持久的全行业衰退之一。【原文：Shell Plc’s Chief Executive Officer pledged to turn around the company’s struggling chemicals business, which he said is suffering from one of the most protracted industry-wide slumps in a long time.】
